bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I would like to be able to save checkpoints with custom names that include the value of my , ie. . The <denchmark-link:https://pytorch-lightning.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pytorch_lightning.callbacks.html#pytorch_lightning.callbacks.ModelCheckpoint>documentation</denchmark-link> for suggests that this is possible using the argument. This does not appear to be the case, since the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/PyTorch-Lightning/blob/master/pytorch_lightning/callbacks/pt_callbacks.py#L247>source code</denchmark-link> calls . I have also tried using the argument, but it doesn't seem to be possible to pass it a format string containing a variable. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The documentation claims that filepath='{epoch:02d}-{val_loss:.2f}.hdf5' will save a checkpoint at /path/epoch_2-val_loss_0.2.hdf5. Instead, it saves a checkpoint at {epoch:02d}-{val_loss:.2f}.hdf5/_ckpt_epoch_1.ckpt. The issues in the documentation are two-fold: -- It suggests that filepath can contain the directory + name of the checkpoint, when it seems like it should only contain the directory specifying where to save. -- It suggests that it can 'contain named formatting options to be auto-filled', which also doesn't seem to be the case. Is it possible to achieve this functionality with the prefix argument instead? If so, how?
